project.name: thesilentsteno
project.description: Bluetooth AI Meeting Recorder - A Raspberry Pi 5 device that acts as an invisible audio intermediary for AI-powered transcription and analysis
project.tech_stack: Python, Raspberry Pi 5, BlueZ Bluetooth, Whisper AI, Local LLM (Phi-3 Mini), SQLite, Touch UI
project.deployment: Raspberry Pi 5 with 3.5-5 inch touchscreen, wall-powered device

documentation.architecture_notes: Bluetooth audio proxy with dual A2DP connections, real-time audio pipeline with <40ms latency, local AI processing chain

scripts/setup_hardware.sh.description: Automates Pi 5 hardware configuration and development tool installation

config/display_config.txt.description: Touchscreen display configuration and calibration settings

scripts/autostart.sh.description: Configures system to auto-boot to main application

docs/hardware_setup.md.description: Complete hardware setup and troubleshooting guide

architecture.main_flow: Phone → Bluetooth A2DP → Pi 5 Audio Capture → Audio Forwarding → Headphones + Real-time AI Processing
architecture.data_flow: Live Audio → Voice Activity Detection → Whisper Transcription → LLM Analysis → Local Storage → Export Options
architecture.configuration: Touch UI for device settings, Bluetooth pairing, AI model configuration, storage management

development.approach: manifest-driven development with git workflow integration
development.workflow: process_task -> implement_task -> check_task -> resolve_mismatch (if needed) -> commit_task
development.current_phase: Phase 1: Foundation & Hardware Setup - Task 1.1 complete
development.version_control: git commits tied to task completion with detailed commit messages

performance_targets.storage_capacity: 32GB+ SD card supporting 20+ hours of meetings

hardware_requirements.audio: Built-in audio + optional USB audio interface
